title: 114_s1679
content: The Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act may be cited as the "Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act". It pertains to private flood insurance. The Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act requires that no federal financial assistance can be approved for construction in flood-prone areas without flood insurance coverage. Flood insurance must be equal to the amount required by federal flood insurance. The Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act mandates that federal financial assistance for construction in flood-prone areas must include flood insurance coverage equal to the required amount by federal flood insurance or private flood insurance. The Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act requires maintaining flood insurance for the life of the property, even after transfer of ownership. Regulated lending institutions are directed not to provide loans for properties in flood hazard areas without flood insurance availability. The Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act mandates continuous flood insurance coverage for properties in flood hazard areas, even after ownership transfer. Lenders must ensure that buildings or mobile homes securing loans are covered by flood insurance equal to the outstanding loan balance or the maximum limit of coverage available. Federal agency lenders must require flood insurance for properties in flood hazard areas identified by the Administrator. Regulations must be consistent with the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968. Federal agency lenders must accept flood insurance that meets coverage requirements. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation must implement procedures for loans secured by properties in identified flood hazard areas. Federal agency lenders must accept flood insurance that meets coverage requirements for properties in identified flood hazard areas. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation will consider flood insurance as satisfying the coverage requirement for loans secured by properties in flood hazard areas. The Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 specifies the applicability of flood insurance requirements for loans made by lenders supervised by the Farm Credit Administration. The Act outlines different timelines for existing coverage and new coverage, with specific conditions for loans made, increased, extended, or renewed after certain dates. The regulations for flood insurance requirements specified in the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 will continue to apply until new regulations are in effect. Any mention of flood insurance in this section includes both Federal and private flood insurance. In this section, flood insurance refers to Federal flood insurance and private flood insurance. Federal flood insurance is provided under the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968, while private flood insurance is issued by approved insurance companies. The text chunk discusses the eligibility criteria for insurers to provide insurance in a specific state or as a nonadmitted insurer in the insured's home state. This is in accordance with the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act. The text chunk outlines the eligibility criteria for insurers to provide flood insurance in a State, as defined in the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act. The text chunk discusses amendments to the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 regarding private flood insurance coverage and continuous coverage requirements. The National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 has been amended to include private flood insurance coverage with continuous coverage requirements. Flood insurance is defined as a period of continuous coverage.
